definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To unite or associate in a herd; to feed or run together, or in company.
( transitive ) To unite or associate in a herd
( transitive ) To manage, care for or guard a herd
examples: He is employed to herd the goats.

definitions.definition: ( intransitive ) To associate; to ally oneself with, or place oneself among, a group or company.
To move, or be moved, in a group. ( of both animals and people )
examples: On alighting at the station, we were all herded over the footbridge and through a side exit.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To unite or associate in a herd; to feed or run together, or in company.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To unite or associate in a herd
( transitive ) To manage, care for or guard a herd
( intransitive ) To associate; to ally oneself with, or place oneself among, a group or company.
To move, or be moved, in a group. ( of both animals and people )

definitions.definition: To act as a herdsman or a shepherd.
To form or put into a herd.
To move or drive a herd.
examples: I heard the herd of cattle being herded home from a long way away.

main_definition: ( intransitive , Scotland ) To act as a herdsman or a shepherd.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive ) To form or put into a herd.
( transitive ) To move or drive a herd.
